source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_SEQ_00<tab>Lord Hien has at last reached a decision.
target: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_SEQ_00<tab>帰燕館のヒエンは、アサヒとの会談に臨もうとしているようだ。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_SEQ_01<tab>Lord Hien has agreed to the proposed exchange of prisoners on one condition: that Yotsuyu be granted exemption from the transaction should her memory fail to return by the appointed hour. Though plainly displeased by this stipulation, Asahi eventually consents, but not without making one final request: a moment to speak with his beloved sister in private. Hien duly grants his wish, and Asahi is admitted to Yotsuyu's quarters. Doing your best to ignore Gosetsu's obvious anxiety, you wait without, imagining the worst, but when Asahi finally emerges, he concedes that Yotsuyu's condition is not feigned, and entrusts her to Hien's care. It would seem that all is well.
target: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_SEQ_01<tab>捕虜交換に関する取り決めは、ひとまずの合意に至った。ヨツユは、義弟アサヒと会っても記憶を取り戻さなかったようだ。全権大使の見送りのためドマ町人地へ出ていった「ヒエン」と話そう。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_SEQ_02<tab>Having agreed upon the finer details of the exchange, there is naught left to do but bid Asahi and his associates farewell. You dutifully escort them back to their ship along the bank of the One River.
target: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_SEQ_02<tab>ヒエンと話した。アサヒたちを見送るため、ヤンサへ向かおう。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_SEQ_03<tab>Moments prior to departing, Asahi pulls you aside to offer special thanks. Or so he claims. With his back turned to the others, his smile quickly changes to a scowl, and he issues an ominous threat. Yet even as he begins to speak, you are overcome by a vision of the past, wherein you discover he is in fact a fervent admirer of the late Lord Zenos. Realizing you have witnessed his thoughts only serves to stoke the flames in his eyes, and he castigates you for presuming to oppose his master before stalking away. You watch openmouthed as his airship disappears into the distance, dumbfounded by his sudden show of petulance.
target: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_SEQ_03<tab>別れの場で、アサヒはゼノスの信奉者である本性を明かし、冒険者へ怨嗟の言葉を告げて去っていった。アサヒの残した言葉と、過去視で見た内容を伝えるため、カストルム・フルーミニス付近の「ヒエン」と話そう。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_SEQ_04<tab>Noting your troubled expression, Hien asks if something is amiss, and you distractedly recount your exchange with Asahi. The tale leaves Yugiri and Alisaie understandably aghast, but Hien appears unmoved. Though he concedes the incident does not bode well for the coming prisoner exchange, he remains determined to see it through. After assuring you that he will send word when all of the necessary preparations have been made, he bids you rest, and so you depart for Kugane together with Alphinaud and Alisaie.
target: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_SEQ_04<tab>ヒエンは、帝国軍に徴兵されたドマの民を取り戻すため、アサヒの本性がどんなものであろうと、捕虜交換を取りやめるつもりはないようだ。捕虜交換のための準備はヒエンたちに任せて、冒険者たちは連絡があるまで待機することになった。クガネのウルダハ商館応接室で「ハンコック」と話そう。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_SEQ_05<tab>Despite your best efforts, the questions raised by Yotsuyu's return have yet to be satisfactorily answered, and the appearance of her stepbrother only adds to the uncertainty. Yet the light of hope cannot be suffered to dim. Regardless of Asahi's aims, you and yours must be ready, that Doma might never again fall under the shadow of imperial rule.
target: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_SEQ_05<tab>アルフィノたちは、ウルダハ商館で捕虜交換まで備えるらしい。本性を現したアサヒ、記憶を失ったままのヨツユなど、捕虜交換にあたっての不安材料はいまだ多く残っている。争いと支配の闇夜を抜け出し、未来へと至る暁光が差しはじめているドマに、再びの影を落とさぬよう、準備と心構えを怠らずにおこう。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_TODO_00<tab>Speak with Hien.
target: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_TODO_00<tab>ドマ町人地のヒエンと話し、見送りに向かう

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_TODO_01<tab>Speak with Hien.
target: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_TODO_01<tab>ドマ町人地のヒエンと話し、見送りに向かう

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_TODO_02<tab>Speak with Hien.
target: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_TODO_02<tab>カストルム・フルーミニス付近のヒエンと話す

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_TODO_03<tab>Speak with Hancock at the Ruby Bazaar in Kugane.
target: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_TODO_03<tab>ウルダハ商館応接室のハンコックと話す

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ALPHINAUD_100_000<tab>I had no idea Yotsuyu's return weighed so heavily on Lord Hien's mind...
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ALPHINAUD_100_000罪がいずる場所、そして行き着く場所、か……。
これまで、そのようなことを考えたことはなかったよ。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ALISAIE_105_000<tab>I couldn't say if Yotsu─I mean, <var 1A 02 /var>Tsuyu's<var 1A 01 /var> predicament is the will of the kami, but Gosetsu certainly seems convinced.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ALISAIE_105_000天より与えられた、新たな命……。
ゴウセツは本気でヨツユを……
いえ、「ツユ」を守り抜くつもりなのね。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_HAKURO_110_000<tab>It would seem Lord Hien has at last reached a decision. The uncertainty in his eyes has given way to resolve.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_HAKURO_110_000ヒエン様は答えを出されたようだな。
瞳に宿っていた憂いが消えた……
やはり我が主には、そうした顔が似合う。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_YUGIRI_115_000<tab>Please tell me Lord Hien is ready to speak with the ambassador. The residents of the enclave grow restless for want of news.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_YUGIRI_115_000ヒエン様の御用はすんだのか？
町人地の民もよく我慢してくれているが、
やはり、徐々に不安が募ってきているようだな……。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ASAHI_120_000<tab>Have you heard aught from Lord Hien? I had hoped he might have had sufficient time to consider my proposal.
target: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ASAHI_120_000<tab>そろそろ、ヒエン様も答えを出されましたか？

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_MAXIMA_125_000<tab>The Empire works for the betterment of all. But I see the fear in these people's eyes... Mistakes have been made.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_MAXIMA_125_000帝国軍の所業を思えば仕方のないことですが、
時おり感じる恐怖の視線が、胸に応えます……。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_KIENKANGATEKEEPER03028_000_010<tab>Lord Hien is expecting you. May I show you in?
target: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_KIENKANGATEKEEPER03028_000_010<tab>ヒエン様の館「帰燕館」へ入られますか？

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_EVENTAREA_WARP_000_011<tab>Enter the Kienkan?
target: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_EVENTAREA_WARP_000_011<tab>「帰燕館」へ入りますか？

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_HIEN_000_000<tab>With Yotsuyu safely in Gosetsu's care, all that remains is to answer Asahi's proposal. I realize other matters demand your attention, but I would ask that you stay awhile longer to see this business through.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_HIEN_000_000さあ、これでヨツユの処遇も決まった。
あとは、わしの決定を大使殿へ伝えるのみだ。
すまぬが引き続き、そなたらも同席してくれ。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_GOSETSU_000_048<tab>Forgive me, my lord, but...has he not been gone overlong? Perhaps I should─
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_GOSETSU_000_048……ふたりきりで、というから座敷を離れたものの。
少々、時間が経ちすぎてはござらぬか？
やはり、拙者が様子を……。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_HIEN_000_049<tab>Calm yourself, Gosetsu. I understand your concern, but we have to wait. He deserves that much.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_HIEN_000_049落ち着け、ゴウセツ。
ふたりきりというのが、大使殿の望み。
逸る気持ちはわかるが……今できるのは待つことのみよ。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ASAHI_000_050<tab>I am sorry to have kept you all waiting. Thank you for your understanding.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ASAHI_000_050お待たせいたしました……。
ふたりだけの時間を作っていただき感謝いたします。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ASAHI_000_051<tab>Long did I dream of this reunion, but never did I imagine it would be so joyless. A part of me hoped your stories of her condition were just that. But alas, it is as you say.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ASAHI_000_051おかげさまで、久方ぶりに姉と会えました。
ですが、実際に記憶を失くしている様を目の当たりにすると、
やはり辛いものがありますね……。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_GOSETSU_000_052<tab>Tsuyu... Do you remember anything of this man? Anything at all?
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_GOSETSU_000_052どうだ、ツユよ……。
この方とお会いして、何か感じるものはあったか……？

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_YOTSUYU_000_053<tab>I... No.
target: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_YOTSUYU_000_053<tab>ううん……何も……。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ASAHI_000_054<tab>I am a stranger to her. That much was clear to me from a single look. I leave her in your care.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ASAHI_000_054残念ながら、私の顔を見ても何も思い出しませんでした。
姉は、ひとまずドマにお預けいたしましょう。
どうか、よろしくお願いいたします……。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_HIEN_100_054<tab>As you wish.
target: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_HIEN_100_054<tab>相わかった。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ASAHI_000_055<tab>Now, if you will excuse me, my superiors are long overdue a report. They will be elated to hear of our agreement, of that I have no doubt.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ASAHI_000_055では、私どもはこれで失礼いたします……。
合意した内容を、急ぎ皇帝陛下へと報告する必要がありますので。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ASAHI_000_056<tab>As for the exchange itself, once I have obtained the relevant permissions, I will arrange for your people to be relieved of their various duties, and sent here to Yanxia. This will take time, of course...
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ASAHI_000_056そうそう、捕虜交換の日程ですが、
皇帝陛下の承認を得たのち、徴用兵らを任地から招集……
その後、ヤンサへ移送することになるため、少々時間が必要です。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_HIEN_000_057<tab>Of course. You may rest assured your soldiers will be well cared for until your return. We will also begin taking steps to better counter the threat of the Kojin and their eikon.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_HIEN_000_057承知した、こちらも貴殿の再訪を待つ間に、
蛮神対策や捕虜の引き渡し準備を進めておこう。

source:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_HIEN_000_058Before you take your leave─there is one other matter...
I am informed it was you who took the lead in rescuing two young Domans from a band of Kojin sellswords. I have not yet had the time to thank you properly.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_HIEN_000_058それと、ここまで機会がなく謝辞が遅れてしまったが……
ナマイ村の民、イッセとアザミを守ってくれたそうだな。
彼らの命を救ってくれたこと、感謝いたす。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ASAHI_000_059<tab>Please, there is no need to thank me. I only did what anyone would do under the circumstances. Fortunately, I was in good company at the time.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ASAHI_000_059いえ、そんな……。
視察中にたまたま遭遇しただけですし、
英雄殿たちも一緒でしたから。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ASAHI_000_060<tab>The blight of the Red Kojin is of the Empire's making. Were it not for our transgressions, those children would not have needed saving.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ASAHI_000_060それに、紅甲羅が起こした事件となれば、
その原因は、我が帝国の行いによる歪みにあるといえましょう。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ASAHI_000_061<tab>The people of Doma have suffered enough, my lord. And I promise to do all in my power to spare them further pain, be it at the hands of the Kojin, or indeed the Empire.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ASAHI_000_061ドマの民は、もう充分すぎるほど傷つきました。
これ以上の痛みを味わうことがないよう、
微力ながら、私も努める所存です。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_HIEN_000_062<tab>I pray the Emperor will see things as you do. There may yet be hope for us all.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_HIEN_000_062うむ……貴国の皇帝がよい決断を下されるよう、
よしなに頼む。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ASAHI_000_063<tab>Until we meet again.
target: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ASAHI_000_063<tab>それじゃ、姉さん……また、会いましょう。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_HIEN_000_064<tab>Gosetsu. As before, I leave Yotsuyu to you.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_HIEN_000_064ゴウセツ、引き続きヨツユの面倒を見てやってくれ。
わしは最後にひと仕事のこっておるのでな。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_HIEN_000_065<tab>I invite the rest of you to join me outside. Let's treat Asahi to a proper farewell.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_HIEN_000_065ユウギリと)) (( )) 02 /var>たちは、
わしと一緒に外まで付き合ってくれ。
最後の大仕事、大使殿らの見送りといくぞ！

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ALPHINAUD_000_070<tab>Without the threat of imperial attack hanging over our heads, we may devote our energies to dealing with the Red Kojin. And then there will be nothing left to impede Doma's restoration.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ALPHINAUD_000_070帝国による干渉の危険がなくなれば、
自ずと紅甲羅の封じ込めも容易になるだろう。
そうなれば、ドマ復興の脅威は大きく減じるはずだ。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ALISAIE_000_073<tab>If only our previous encounters with the Empire had been this cordial. Here's to the future, I suppose...
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ALISAIE_000_073なんだか、このまま無事に終わりそうね。
この調子で和平まで一気に進むといいのだけれど。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_YUGIRI_000_075<tab>I wondered if the sight of her stepbrother might bring Yotsuyu back to her senses...but mayhap nothing will. Nevertheless, we must continue to watch her until we can be certain that her condition is permanent.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_YUGIRI_000_075大使殿と部屋を出てきたときの、ヨツユの呆けた顔。
あの表情は、とても演技とは思えなかった……。
……まだ、監視を止めるわけにはいかぬがな。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ASAHI_000_078<tab>If my dear sister's memory does not return, I pray you will take good care of her.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ASAHI_000_078姉のこと、どうかよろしくお願いいたします。
弟としては、記憶を取り戻してほしいところですが……。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_MAXIMA_000_080<tab>Lord Hien has made a wise decision. Our superiors will be pleased.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_MAXIMA_000_080ヒエン様のくだした御決断、
確かに、本国へとお伝えさせていただきます。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_HAKURO_000_083<tab>If Yotsuyu is to remain in Doma for good, we cannot keep her confined to this manor. The people must be made to see that she is no longer the monster they remember.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_HAKURO_000_083死すまで帰燕館に閉じ込めておくわけにもいくまい。
ヨツユが、今後ドマで暮らしていくというのならば、
いつかは民の理解を得なければならんな……。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_HIEN_000_090<tab>The ambassador's airship awaits at Castrum Fluminis. Let us be off.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_HIEN_000_090大使殿は、来訪のときと同様に、
カストルム・フルーミニスから飛空戦艦へと帰艦するらしい。
それでは、わしらも向かおうぞ。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ALPHINAUD_000_100<tab>Are you quite well? You looked as if you were about to faint in the ambassador's arms for a moment there.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ALPHINAUD_000_100大丈夫かい……？
アサヒと話しているとき、一瞬ふらついていたようだが。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ALISAIE_000_103<tab>Why the frown? Did he say something to upset you?
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ALISAIE_000_103どうしたの、そんなに顔をしかめて。
……今、アサヒに何を言われたの？

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_YUGIRI_000_105<tab>I thought perhaps now we could be at ease, but your expression suggests otherwise. What troubles you, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>?
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_YUGIRI_000_105これで、ひとまず肩の荷がおりた……とはいかないようだな。
その険しい顔、大使殿に何を言われたのか、
ヒエン様に伝えてくれぬか。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ALISAIE_000_149<tab>It makes no sense. Why would he bother keeping up the pretense for so long, only to drop it right before the very end?
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ALISAIE_000_149……でも、何故アサヒはこのタイミングで本性を現したのかしら。
最後まで、私たちを欺くこともできたはずなのに。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ALPHINAUD_101_149<tab>Perhaps he no longer thought it necessary, having secured Doma's cooperation in the prisoner exchange.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ALPHINAUD_101_149皇帝の勅命に応えるため、
芝居をしてでも、捕虜交換の約束を取りつけたかったのだろう。
だが、ひとまずの使命を果たした以上、芝居も無用ということ。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_HIEN_102_149<tab>If he truly is a disciple of Zenos, 'tis possible emotions simply got the better of him. Remaining calm around the <var 08 E905 ((woman)) ((man)) /var> who slew his lord will have taken its toll.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_HIEN_102_149ゼノスの熱狂的な信奉者となれば、
仇を前に毒のひとつも吐きたくなったか……。
やれやれ、いずれ来る再会に備え、警戒を強めねばな。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_HIEN_000_150<tab>Whatever the explanation, now is not the time for hasty reprisals.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_HIEN_000_150……しかし、それも今しばらくは先のこと。
大使殿の本性は留意しておく必要があるが、
状況としては、ひとまず落ち着いたと言ってよかろう。

source:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_HIEN_000_151We shall proceed as planned. The Red Kojin must be placed under surveillance and the Garlean prisoners made ready for the exchange...
But you need not concern yourself with the details.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_HIEN_000_151蛮神召喚を食い止めるための監視体制や、
ドマにいる帝国軍捕虜を集めたり、やらねばならんことは多い。
……が、それらは国内のわしらだけで対応できること。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_HIEN_000_152<tab>Leave the affairs of Doma to us. When the hour of the exchange draws near, we will call for you.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_HIEN_000_152そなたらからは、すでに十分な助言と力添えをもらった。
いざ捕虜交換に挑む段には、また協力を請うことになろうが、
それまでの些事は、わしらに任せてくれ。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ALPHINAUD_000_153<tab>I should certainly hope so. Whatever the Empire's true intent, we would be on hand to play our part, either to defend Doma, or to help usher in a lasting peace.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ALPHINAUD_000_153承知しました。
こちらからも、捕虜交換の場への同席をお願いさせてください。
合意が成されるか否か、しっかり見届けておきたいのです。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ALPHINAUD_000_154<tab>I had thought we might use this time to return to Eorzea, but given the volatility of the situation, mayhap it would be best if we remained in Kugane.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ALPHINAUD_000_154それから、私とアリゼーは、
しばらくウルダハ商館に詰めていようと思います。
御用のときは、クガネまで報せてください。

source:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ALISAIE_000_156Agreed. Between Yotsuyu's amnesia and Asahi's dubious agenda, I'd say we have ample reason to remain in the neighborhood.
If anything should happen─anything at all─you must send for us at once.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ALISAIE_000_156そうね、ヨツユの記憶を含めて、不安定な要素はいくつもあるもの。
もし、何かあれば、また知らせてちょうだい。
すぐに駆けつけるから。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_HIEN_000_157<tab>Oh, I will. On that you have my word. Charting a path through this sea of troubles promises to be difficult enough. I am not so proud as to attempt the feat alone.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_HIEN_000_157ああ、そなたたちの力、今しばらく頼りにさせてくれ。
この先、どれほどの大波がドマを襲うかわからんからな……。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ALPHINAUD_000_158<tab>To Kugane, then. Tataru and the others must know of what transpired here.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ALPHINAUD_000_158……それでは、クガネの「ウルダハ商館」へ戻るとしよう。
タタルにも、状況を共有しなければいけないからね。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_HIEN_000_160<tab>If what you saw of the ambassador is an indication of his true nature, this prisoner exchange may not be what it seems. In fact, I'm beginning to wonder if your encounter with the Red Kojin was more than mere happenstance.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_HIEN_000_160大使殿が最後に見せた憎しみの顔が本性ならば、
次の来訪時、素直に捕虜交換が行えるという確証はない。
こうなると紅甲羅の襲撃も、どこまで「偶然」だったのか……。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_YUGIRI_000_163<tab>Soon we shall see if Asahi is true to his word. If not, I will be glad to cut out that silver tongue of his.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_YUGIRI_000_163アサヒがなにを目論んでいようと、
ドマに仇成す企みならば、打ち砕くのみだ……！

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ALPHINAUD_000_165<tab>Since we have naught else to attend to for the moment, perhaps this would be a good opportunity to look into the present state of Garlemald...? Though I should probably speak with Tataru first...
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ALPHINAUD_000_165さて、しばらくは待機だね。
この期間を利用して、帝国の状況を改めて探ってみるか……。
それから……タタルへの謝罪も必要だな……。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ALISAIE_000_168<tab>I don't envy Lord Hien. So much rests on his decision.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ALISAIE_000_168ヒエンの決意の言葉……。
彼の肩に、どれほどのものが背負われているのかを、
感じずにはいられなかったわ。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_TATARU_000_170<tab>Welcome back, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>! We heard the good news about Gosetsu! I <var 1A 02 /var>knew<var 1A 01 /var> you'd find him!
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_TATARU_000_170おかえりなさいまっせ。
ゴウセツさんを無事に救い出せたのでっすね！
そのままドマにまで出向くなんて……本当にお疲れ様でっした！

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_HANCOCK_000_180<tab>...My. It seems you're all in quite the predicament. Well, should we receive any urgent missives from Doma, rest assured you will be the first to know of it.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_HANCOCK_000_180……なるほど、承知いたしマシタ！
タタルさんと私も、ドマからの連絡に備えておきますネ～！

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_TATARU_000_185<tab>Yes, of course. We're pursuing a number of ventures to replenish our coffers, but I suppose that all can wait if any urgent news should come through the office.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_TATARU_000_185任せておいてくだっさい！
失われた資金を補填する目処も、ある程度立ちましたし、
ドマとの連絡役、バッチリ両立してみせまっしょう！

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_TATARU_000_190<tab>Yes, of course. We're discussing ideas to replenish our coffers, but I suppose that all can wait if any urgent news should come through the office.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_TATARU_000_190任せておいてくだっさい！
失われた資金の補填も、ソロバンさんに良案があるとのこと……。
儲け話もドマとの連絡役も、バッチリこなしてみせまっしょう！

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ALPHINAUD_000_191<tab>Ah... Ahem. About that... I wish to apologize, Tataru. It was reckless of me to make such a purchase without first consulting you. You may be certain, however, that I mean to reimburse the Scions, even if it means drawing upon my personal funds.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ALPHINAUD_000_191そ、そうだね……タタルには世話をかける……。
使った資金は、私の個人資産からも返却させてもらうので……。
なんなら、商館にいる間、私にできることがあれば……。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_TATARU_000_192<tab>That's very thoughtful of you, but I'm sure it won't come to that.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_TATARU_000_192お気持ちはありがたいのでっすが、今は結構でっす。
アルフィノさんも、自分がしてしまったことの重みを、
わかってくださったようでっすし……。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_TATARU_000_193<tab>If Soroban's business proposition is as promising as it sounds, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var> should have no difficulty wiping the red from our ledger.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_TATARU_000_193それに、)) (( )) 02 /var>さんなら、
ソロバンさんの儲け話も、上手くこなしてくれるでっしょう。
そうすれば、補填どころか一気に黒字化も……フフフフフフ。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ALPHINAUD_000_194<tab>Forgive me, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>. It would seem I have unwittingly heaped my financial troubles upon you. I swear I will pay you back.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ALPHINAUD_000_194す、すまない、)) (( )) 02 /var>……
私の不手際で、君に迷惑をかける結果になってしまったようだ。
この借りは、必ず返させてもらうよ……。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ALPHINAUD_100_194<tab>Though I fear I will struggle to cobble together anything of monetary value, knowledge I can gather in abundance. To start, I plan to investigate the divisions forming within the Empire. Mayhap Riol and his associates have heard something on the subject...
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ALPHINAUD_100_194だが、私とて役には立ってみせる！
リオルたちと連携しつつ、帝国の内情を探ってみるつもりだ！

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ALPHINAUD_000_195<tab>Regardless, the more we know about the politics of Garlemald, the better our chances of predicting the imperials' next move, which <var 1A 02 /var>might<var 1A 01 /var> yield you an advantage on the day of the prisoner exchange.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ALPHINAUD_000_195頼み事ばかりですまないが、
君も、折を見て様子を見に来てくれると助かる……。
捕虜交換の場には、ぜひとも同席してもらいたいからね。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ALPHINAUD_000_196<tab>Knowing what we do of Asahi's apparent resentment towards you, I cannot say what he hopes to gain from it.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ALPHINAUD_000_196アサヒの、君への恨み方を聞くに、
ドマの民を想い語った言葉も、すべて偽りだった可能性が高い。
彼の目的は、いまだ不透明だが……。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ALPHINAUD_000_197<tab>But if there is even the faintest chance that a lasting peace could be forged between Doma and the Empire, what choice have we but to try? Lord Hien had the right of it: Asahi may very well be a monster, but we must play his game. For now.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ALPHINAUD_000_197ヨツユによる支配を抜け出し、
ようやくドマに、新たな未来へと至る光が差しはじめたんだ。
この光に影を落とさぬよう、なんとしても捕虜交換を成功させよう。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ASAHI_000_400<tab>Arranging the prisoner exchange proved easier than I thought.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ASAHI_000_400ヴァリス帝からの勅命である、和平交渉は取りつけた。
信頼を得るための猿芝居まで演じてな……。

source: TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ASAHI_000_401<tab>Yes, my lord will be most pleased. Everything is going according to plan.
target:
TEXT_STMBDC108_03029_ASAHI_000_401だが、我がまことの主は、あの御方のみ……
殿下の大計は、すでに始まっているのだ……。
